snippet: Environmentalists and a representative of California's lumber industry have agreed on proposed legislation that would help save redwood forests from logging and would otherwise restrict timber harvesting in the state.    Such a voluntary agreement...
lead_paragraph: Environmentalists and a representative of California's lumber industry have agreed on proposed legislation that would help save redwood forests from logging and would otherwise restrict timber harvesting in the state. Such a voluntary agreement could serve as a national precedent, both in the specifics of forestry regulation and as a way to solve the contentious issues that have divided lumber companies and environmentalists.

headline.main: Accord Is Reached on Rescuing Redwood Forests

byline.original: By ANDREW POLLACK, Special to The New York Times
